intro: Aster kodzumanus, commonly known as the Kodzumanus aster, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
